org.ctoolkit.restapi.client.provider

Interface LocalResourceProvider<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the resource

    public interface LocalResourceProvider<T>
    The interface that provides possibility to plug-in right before a remote resource retrieval (either get or list). The implementation of concrete type is optional and will be used once binded in guice configuration.

    To bind a concrete implementation use this in your guice module: 

    bind( new TypeLiteral<LocalResourceProvider<MyResource>>(){} )
      .to( MyResourceProvider.class );
    Author:
    Aurel Medvegy

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(Object identifier, Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale, Date lastModifiedDate)
      Retrieve a local resource to avoid a remote call.
      List<T> list(Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale, Date lastModifiedDate)
      Retrieve a local list of resource to avoid a remote call.
      void persist(T instance, Object identifier, Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale)
      Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call.
      void persistList(List<T> instance, Map<String,Object> parameters, Locale locale)
      Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get(Object identifier,
    @Nullable
    Map<String,Object> parameters,
    @Nullable
    Locale locale,
    @Nullable
    Date lastModifiedDate)
        Retrieve a local resource to avoid a remote call. Note: if this method returns null it will make call of persist(Object, Object, Map, Locale) once a remote resource call returns a non null value. Processed in the same thread.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the unique identifier of the resource
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable
        lastModifiedDate - the last modified date of the remote resource if any
        Returns:
        the locally cached or stored resource if exist, otherwise returns null

      • persist

        void persist(@Nonnull
           T instance,
           @Nullable
           Object identifier,
           @Nullable
           Map<String,Object> parameters,
           @Nullable
           Locale locale)
        Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call. This method will be called in case if get(Object, Map, Locale, Date) returns null and for a non null result of the remote call. Processed in the same thread.

        Note: prefer asynchronous implementation.

        Parameters:
        instance - the resource instance to be either persisted or cached
        identifier - the unique identifier of the resource
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable

      • list

        List<T> list(@Nullable
           Map<String,Object> parameters,
           @Nullable
           Locale locale,
           @Nullable
           Date lastModifiedDate)
        Retrieve a local list of resource to avoid a remote call. Note: if this method returns null it will make call of persistList(List, Map, Locale) once a remote resource call returns a non null value. Processed in the same thread.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable
        lastModifiedDate - the last modified date of the remote resource if any
        Returns:
        the locally cached or stored resource if exist, otherwise returns null

      • persistList

        void persistList(@Nonnull
               List<T> instance,
               @Nullable
               Map<String,Object> parameters,
               @Nullable
               Locale locale)
        Optionally, persist the resource instance as a result of the remote call. This method will be called in case if list(Map, Locale, Date) returns null and for a non null result of the remote call. Processed in the same thread.

        Note: prefer asynchronous implementation.

        Parameters:
        instance - the resource instance to be either persisted or cached
        parameters - the optional resource parameters
        locale - the language the client has configured to prefer in results if applicable
